items.abstract: Here, we demonstrate a novel method of measurement which determines precisely the hydrodynamic resistance of a droplet flowing through a channel.
title: Measurement of the hydrodynamic resistance of microdroplets

items.abstract: Bacterial growth in an aqueous medium in the vicinity of the interface with an immiscible oxygenated fluid is a subject of this study. We tested six oxygenated liquids, including hexadecane, silicone oil, FC-40, FC-70, HFE-7200 and HFE-7500.
title: Enhancement of bacterial growth with the help of immiscible oxygenated oils

items.abstract: We report a droplet microfluidic system that automates the formation of lipid bilayers and allows for electrophysiological measurements and for an automated screening protocols in which the activity of proteins is tested against inhibitors.
title: A droplet microfluidic system for sequential generation of lipid bilayers and transmembrane electrical recordings
